intro: Aniseia calystegioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anise tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Aniseia calystegioides is often found in moist, open habitats such as savannas and forest edges.
